runs.comm: short ball banged in first up, it's a quick one from Powell and Smith tries to pull away from a stroke and gets hit on the arm. He needs treatment. The physio has come on.
cut to third-man
outswinger, quite full, left alone
short of a good length and on the stumps, played defensively
short of a length and outside the off, played down towards gully
short ball, Gibbs launches into the pull but is early on the shot, off the toe end of the bat down to point
short of a length and outside the off, played down to point
full and quite straight, inside-edged to the leg side, Smith looks in some pain here after that blow to the hand
short of a good length and on the leg stump, flick played and missed, off the pads down to fine-leg
short of a length and outside the off, Gibbs opens the face of the bat and runs the ball down to third-man
fuller and on the pads, worked down to fine-leg
Slap! first big hit from South Africa. Gibbs launches a ball from outside the off back past the bowler to the long-on fence
short of a length and on the off, pulled to the on side
down the leg side, played at and missed, through to the keeper
short ball, on the stumps, Smith goes back and pulls the ball well over midwicket. The pain in the hand might lessen with shots like that
full and on the off, driven inside out to cover
very full and on the stumps, driven back down towards mid-off
overpitched and quite straight, whipped to the leg side but not past the fielder at midwicket
Maximum! very full and outside the off, Gibbs hits that really well, timing the ball over extra-cover and it goes all the way
Now Smith comes to the party. He charges down the pitch and hits the ball cleanly over midwicket. That's a big hit and goes all the way
short of a length once more, on the leg stump, pulled through square-leg
short and a bit of width, Gibbs sees that really early, gets in place and pulls superbly over midwicket. What's more, it's a no-ball as well and we have a free hit coming ...
down the pitch and crack, that's hit well through midwicket. Fidel Edwards has to dive and does so brilliantly to save the boundary
slower ball, Smith doesn't pick it and gives Rampaul the charge. He doesn't get to the pitch of the ball though and misses. Through to the keeper
attempted yorker, very full and very straight, dug out to the off side
slower ball, very full and on the stumps, Smith waits on it and drives to mid-on and pinches a quick single
Smith backs away to leg and carves the ball through cover. It's not terribly well hit but finds the gap and has enough on it to run away to the boundary
very full, far down the leg side, played and missed, the umpire has no difficulty calling that a wide
very full and on the pads, Gibbs tries to hit that one into the stands at midwicket. Off a thick inside edge down towards fine-leg
very full, far down the leg side, lots of work for the keeper, no difficulty for the umpire though, wide called
low full-toss on the off, it's the attempted yorker, Smith has a dart at the ball, again it's mis-hit but has enough to land before mid-off, bounce over the fielder and dribble down to the boundary
short one banged in, it's quick too, Smith pulls and misses, through to the keeper
another ball down the leg side, this isn't very flash from Powell. Another wide called
short of a length and on the stumps, heaved through the on side
very full and on the off, played away awkwardly to the leg side
very full, down the leg side, not the place to bowl with fine-leg up in the circle, Smith flicks the ball away quite fine
fullish and quite straight, Smith comes down the pitch and tries to hit inside-out over cover. Chris Gayle bends low and takes a sharp catch and that's the end of Smith's brave stay at the crease
short of a length and outside the off, AB de Villiers has a big square-cut and misses, it's a wide
fullish and outside the off, played at and missed, past the outside edge to the keeper
short of a good length and outside the off, AB de Villiers opens the face of the bat and runs the ball down to third-man
just short of a good length and outside the off, driven inside out past the man at cover
short one banged in, it's pulled down to the leg side, there's a fielder on the ropes and it's a couple of runs as we come to the end of the six-over period when field restrictions apply
short of a good length and outside the off, driven inside out but not past the man at cover
very full and on the stumps, Gibbs waits on the ball and can't do much more than defend the ball back down the pitch
Dropped! full and outside the off, Gibbs drives inside out and over extra-cover, Bravo runs around well and gets into place. The ball goes into hand and then pops out. That could be a costly miss
short of a length and outside the off, Gibbs sees that very early and pulls dramatically over midwicket. Shot
full and on the pads, that's the attempted yorker, Gibbs tries to flick but can only edge the ball back onto pad
full and on the leg stump, flicked down to deep backward square-leg
very full, very wide, a hint of away swing, left well alone as the umpire calls it wide
Big one! Down the track in a flash and a sweetly struck shot from AB de Villiers. The ball clears long-on with some ease
too straight this time and AB de Villiers has all the time in the world to go back and pull over midwicket
worked away through the  on side
very full and down the leg side. indisciplined bowling from West Indies and yet another wide
quite straight, quite full, worked away down towards short fine-leg
full and far down the leg side. Yet another wide and this one will run away to the boundary. No chance for the keeper. This is very poor from Smith/
full and on the pads, worked away through the on side for a single. 20 off the over. Not a great start for Dwayne Smith
down the leg side. Can you believe this? Another wide. Edwards begins in the worst possible fashion

very quick and very straight, AB de Villiers closes the face of the bat a bit early in trying to work the ball to the leg side. The ball goes straight up in the air. It goes very, very high and Ramdin, the wicketkeeper, settles under the catch
just short of a good length, drifting down leg, flick played and missed, rapped on the pad
very short, very quick, that's a good bouncer and gets through to the keeper. Dot ball.
full and far down the leg side. This is rubbish. Left alone and it's easily called a wide.
good yorker fired in to the base of leg stump, the batsman can do no more than jam the bat down and dig the ball out
another excellent yorker. Good pace and Gibbs just about digs the ball out. It's either wides or perfect yorkers from Edwards
short of a good length and outside the off, Gibbs sees it early and drives through the line. One bounce and over the ropes at long-off
full and down the leg side. Here's another West Indian bowler who can't get it on line.
fullish and outside the off, slower ball, played at and missed, through to the keeper
short of a length and outside the off, played down to third-man for a single, Kemp gets off the mark
short of a good length and on the stumps, lapped away over the man at short fine-leg for a boundary
full and on the pads, driven down to long-on, there's a runner on for Herschelle Gibbs. Could be some injury trouble for South Africa
fuullish and outside the off, Gibbs has a heave, thick inside edge and the ball goes past the stumps and the keeper for four
slower ball, driven down to long-on for a single to end the over. At the halfway mark it's 106 for 2
screaming yorker, on the leg stump line, Gibbs just about manages to bring the bat down in time to stab it away to the offside.

peach of a delivery to follow that yorker. It landed on a length, around middle stump and climbed over middle and leg. Gibbs, beaten by the pace and the short-of-driveable length, had a waft at it but missed it completely
fuller, he is mixing them up rather nicely, just outside leg stump, Gibbs can't connect with his flick shot and it thuds into the pad
short in length now, following Gibbs who backed away and Gibbs could only manage a weak pull shot past square leg.
Short in length and at the body, Kemp twists his body to get inside the line and short-arm jabs it to long leg
Ah. Nice variation. A bouncer and a surprised Gibbs ducks
Yorker length, on the leg stump line, stabbed away with the help of  the good old inside edge
another one full in length, dug out towards long-on

Drama. It was a Bravo special - a slower one but Gibbs picked it up late but adjusted to smash it high towards deep midwicket. Chanderpaul moved to his right, came under it but ended up palming it away. He thought he was more closer to the ropes than he really was. He had a meter to play with but thinking he was closer, he just put his hand out behind him and thus grassed the chance
another slower one, on the leg stump line, Kemp is beaten as he went for a big swing and the ball rolled off the pads
fuller, on the off stump, Gibbs backs away to the leg side and creams it straight to deep cover. Just a single though.
Full and down the leg side, Gibbs tries to lap it around the corner, misses and it bobs away of Ramdin's pads to the man at short fine leg
The outside edge. Full in length, outside the off stump, Kemp frees his arm at it and gets a thick edge in bargain
fullish, driven to long-off for a single
Fifty up for Gibbs in style. He went down on his knee to swing a length delivery past midwicket.
fuller, on the leg and middle line, Gibbs has swipe across the line, gets an inside edge onto his pads and it runs away to the off side
The swipe works for Kemp and he gets it past midwicket
Another wide. 19th one. Criminal from West Indies. Way down the leg side

Dropped by Samuels at long-on. Full and in the slot, on the middle stump line, Kemp backed away, attempted to loft it but got under it too much and the ball skied towards long-on. It took a while for gravity to act and it landed in the palms and popped out. In and out.
flat and full, on the off and middle, Gibbs just swats it across the line to deep midwicket
flat and fast again, on the leg stump line and Kemp just turned it away. It looked a mere push but it speeds past square leg and runs to the boundary
Late-cut this time. Cute. Short in length - flat and fast as usual from Samuels and Kemp cut it through third man region
full, on the off and middle, driven to long-on for a single
It's Gibbs turn to ping the long-on region.
yorker length, jabbed away to the leg side
Full,the slow off cutter, just outside off stump but hey this is Twenty20. Gibbs plants his left foot across and just laps it around the corner, between the 'keeper and the short fine-leg fielder
Easy. Full and outside off stump, Gibbs slices it over backward point. He is toying with the bowling. Only arrogance - read overconfidence- is going to do him in
full, attempted yorker , on the off stump, drilled to sweeper cover
low full toss, on the middle, hit back down the track, Rampaul stretches his right hand out and makes a half-stop
Massive. In the slot, around the off stump and Kemp smoked it over long-on. A slight forward movement to clear the front foot and he went through the line
Deja-vu. Another one begging to be hit - halfvolley on the off stump and Kemp obliged. A violent hit through the line of the delivery and it went flying over long-on
fast, flat, full, on the leg stump line, misses a flick and it bounds away off the pad
fullish, on the middle and leg, swiped away to deep midwicket
Samuels was almost decapitated. Gibbs backed away, exposing all the stumps and drilled a fullish delivery right past a startled Samuels
The run orgy continues. A swipe across the line takes the ball to deep square leg boundary. Easy as they come.
retains the strike with a drive to long-off
yorker on the leg stump line, jabbed away towards short fine leg and they rush across for a quick single
It becomes easier. Short in length, on the hips, Kemp short-arm jabs it over short fine leg fielder.
low swinging full toss down the leg side. Wide called.
just falls short of the yorker length, on the leg stump line, wristed past square leg. 100 partnership comes up. They are piling it on here. The crowd love it.
fullish, on the middle and leg, driven to long-on

length delivery on the middle stump, turned to midwicket, de Villiers, running for Gibbs, sets off for a run, Kemp sends him back and had the throw hit, de Villiers would have been short of the crease
keeps it full and straight, stabbed away to the on side.
Massive and its maximum. Full, in the slot, on the off stump and Gibbs stands and delivers. He goes through the line and the white ball flies over long-on.
Only 3 runs more. Gibbs charges out, waits for the slower ball to arrive before lofting it over mid-off.
hits the deck short of length, around the off stump, Gibbs shapes to duck - he thought it would bounce more than it did - and just sways away at the last minute.
slow loopy bouncer but down the leg side and though, Gibbs couldn't connect with his pull shot, they will get a run for the wide. Only two runs more.
South Africa have won. With two overs to spare. Gibbs finished it off in style. Full-pitched, on the off stump line, he cleared the front foot and murdered it over mid-off.
